content.raw:
Can we clarify what's the result of the function in these situations?

* The ray intersects with one edge of the box.
* The ray intersects with one face of the box.
content.html:
Can we clarify what's the result of the function in these situations?

  • The ray intersects with one edge of the box.
  • The ray intersects with one face of the box.

content.raw: Hmm, what should I change? The result is true if the ray intersects any part of the box.
content.html: Hmm, what should I change? The result is true if the ray intersects any part of the box.

content.raw: The intersection between a ray and a box could be a point or a segment, right? The API of this function always returns a double if there's an intersection. My suggestion is to explain in the doxygen section what's the interpretation of the resulted double in the cases where the intersection is a segment. I can guess but it's easier if it's in the doxygen.
content.html: The intersection between a ray and a box could be a point or a segment, right? The API of this function always returns a double if there's an intersection. My suggestion is to explain in the doxygen section what's the interpretation of the resulted double in the cases where the intersection is a segment. I can guess but it's easier if it's in the doxygen.

content.raw: To summarize in the main comment thread: the test is [failing on windows due to timeout](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/scpeters/ign-math/build/1.0.333/job/3au5wltgctalqc73#L1170), while it passes in about 10 seconds on [trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/31/testReport/(root)/HelpersTest/Pair/) and homebrew (testing on my local machine). On Windows, one of the builds failed many expectations, which led to [over 700 MB of console error messages](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/54/console), and presumably a large xml result file. I imagine if the expectations can be fixed, the time to finish the test might improve as well.
content.html: To summarize in the main comment thread: the test is failing on windows due to timeout, while it passes in about 10 seconds on trusty and homebrew (testing on my local machine). On Windows, one of the builds failed many expectations, which led to over 700 MB of console error messages, and presumably a large xml result file. I imagine if the expectations can be fixed, the time to finish the test might improve as well.

content.raw:
I disabled most of the test expectations and added some print statements in
[branch pairing_scpeters](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/pairing_scpeters%0Dpairing#diff)
and triggered a
[new windows build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/sw_ignition/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/58/).

A failure is caused when trying to `Unpair(IGN_UINT64_MAX)` 

~~~
9: [ RUN      ] HelpersTest.Pair
9: _key 18446744073709551615, sqrt 4294967296, sq 0
9: D:\Jenkins\workspace\ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64@2\workspace\ign-math\src\Helpers_TEST.cc(336): error: Value of: maxA
9:   Actual: 4294967295
9: Expected: maxC
9: Which is: 0
~~~

On my mac, the `sqrt` value is printed as `4294967295` (`2^32 - 1`), while on windows it prints as `4294967296` (`2^32`).
It seems like the windows compiler has less precision?
content.html:
I disabled most of the test expectations and added some print statements in branch pairing_scpeters and triggered a new windows build.

A failure is caused when trying to Unpair(IGN_UINT64_MAX) 

9: [ RUN      ] HelpersTest.Pair
9: _key 18446744073709551615, sqrt 4294967296, sq 0
9: D:\Jenkins\workspace\ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64@2\workspace\ign-math\src\Helpers_TEST.cc(336): error: Value of: maxA
9:   Actual: 4294967295
9: Expected: maxC
9: Which is: 0

On my mac, the sqrt value is printed as 4294967295 (2^32 - 1), while on windows it prints as 4294967296 (2^32). It seems like the windows compiler has less precision?

content.raw: If the parameters are reduced (such as `uin64_t`  to `uint32_t`) then everything works. I might have to leave everything reduced. Still looking for an alternative.
content.html: If the parameters are reduced (such as uin64_t to uint32_t) then everything works. I might have to leave everything reduced. Still looking for an alternative.

content.raw:
Found on wikipedia:

 An exception is Microsoft Visual C++ for x86, which makes long double a synonym for double.[2] The Intel C++ compiler on Microsoft Windows supports extended precision, but requires the /Qlong‑double switch for long double to correspond to the hardware's extended precision format.

I'm speechless..
content.html:
Found on wikipedia:

An exception is Microsoft Visual C++ for x86, which makes long double a synonym for double.[2] The Intel C++ compiler on Microsoft Windows supports extended precision, but requires the /Qlong‑double switch for long double to correspond to the hardware's extended precision format.

I'm speechless..
